intro: Epidendrum caracasanum, commonly known as the Caracas orchid, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, humid environments with well-drained soil. The plant features upright, branched stems and produces clusters of fragrant, showy flowers in shades of pink and white. Its roots are epiphytic, allowing it to grow on trees or rocks in its natural habitat. Epidendrum caracasanum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in greenhouses or as a houseplant.
